comments.text:
The output component was changed from raptor-main to raptor-perftest in February
```
[task 2020-04-13T23:58:51.229Z] 23:58:51     INFO -  raptor-perftest Info: Playback recording date: 2019-06-21
```

comments.author: jmaher@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: :davehunt, when there are changes to log output format, markers, tags, etc., could you give a heads up to :trink and :ekyle ?
comments.text: :davehunt, when there are changes to log output format, markers, tags, etc., could you give a heads up to :trink and :ekyle ?
comments.creator: jmaher@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text: It looks like this was from bug 1608374, which landed in mid-January. We can try to keep in mind to inform :trink and :ekyle of changes to the output format, but as these aren't always deliberate changes there is always a risk that some will slip through.
comments.text: It looks like this was from bug 1608374, which landed in mid-January. We can try to keep in mind to inform :trink and :ekyle of changes to the output format, but as these aren't always deliberate changes there is always a risk that some will slip through.
comments.author: dave.hunt@gmail.com
comments.creator: dave.hunt@gmail.com

comments.author: dave.hunt@gmail.com
comments.text: For the recording date, could we provide this as an artifact instead of scraping the logs? We already have this in a JSON file within each of the recording archives.
comments.raw_text: For the recording date, could we provide this as an artifact instead of scraping the logs? We already have this in a JSON file within each of the recording archives.
comments.creator: dave.hunt@gmail.com

comments.author: bebe@mozilla.ro
comments.text: We can output the date easy from raptor in whatever format is required
comments.raw_text: We can output the date easy from raptor in whatever format is required
comments.creator: bebe@mozilla.ro
mtrinkala@mozilla.com
comments.author: mtrinkala@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
In this specific case it seems like the recording date should actually be in the perfherder JSON, is this possible?

As for producing other artifacts or structured logs in addition to the raw log doesn't really solve the problem and just duplicates and bloats the data we store in S3.  My preference would be to put a little more effort into the raw log and dump the mostly duplicated artifacts.
comments.text:

As for producing other artifacts or structured logs in addition to the raw log doesn't really solve the problem and just duplicates and bloats the data we store in S3.  My preference would be to put a little more effort into the raw log and dump the mostly duplicated artifacts.
